Tenho 69 anos de idade curto esta musica toque de silencio desde uma madrugada fria de inverno no ano de 1970,tirando guarda no quartel ,sexto batalhão de engenharia em Porto Alegre,o qual sinto muita saudades ainda,era madrugada eu estava na guarita tirando guarda quando alguém ligou um rádio na cozinha ligaria se às luzes para prepararem o café da manhã,eu ali escutei toda esta musica que até hoje sinto muita saudade,5o anos passarão e parece que foi honrem.

The amount of grinding required to unlock DLC killers and survivor is extraordinary I enjoy the game however I don't want to grind forty hours just to unlock a new character.  

Also gameplay is repetitive as hell.

Esta maomenos, [b]pero a mi[/b] ya se me volvio un poco tedioso de jugarlo por lo repetitivo que es, literalmente tiene 2 modos de juego y la unica diferencia entre partidas son los asesinos, el mapa o los supervivientes que se juegan. Y sin contar que tiene 300 trillones de dlc's que realmente deberian venir incluidos.

Mas de $1000 pesos en todos los dlc's cuando el juego en sí sale $225, un choreo impresionante

No estoy diciendo que el juego sea malo ni nada, solo que yo ya no le encuentro el factor de diversion

It's a shame I have to re-write my review for this game for a 10th time. I've actually completely lost interest in it. You can't have fun anymore. Solo queuing just gets your teammates who sandbag you and lead the killer to you. You get camped on first hook when the game also just started. I'm embarrassed that I spent so much money on cosmetics and DLCs for this game.

This game has been a nice change of pace from the typical fps games I am usually accustomed to. it is fun to play with friends and it can be pretty addicting. The only complaint i have with this game is there is not a whole lot to do other than the only game-mode. I would like to see some fun game-modes added that are more for fun and not ranked. That being said i recommend this game when there is a sale going on. I paid $8 for it and i think that is fair for the amount of substance you get. A $20 price tag is a little too steep for me.

For me, this game is enjoyable and relaxing. I know that many people said that it is annoying because of some player behavior, but they do not bother me.
The games go quickly (10 - 20 minutes), and cooperation gives a lot of fun. Something like cat and mouse fun. Get achievements is rewarding. You can meet lots of friendly behavior from killers, who help u get an achievement. I would recommend!

It's an addicting game. I have only played as survivor, just because I enjoy the team aspect rather than solo as killer. Even after playing for a few weeks killers will catch me by surprise. Michael Myers has scared the bejeebus out of me a handful of times, cracks me up. I have experienced zero bugs within the game and so long as you play in the late afternoon into evening queue times are pretty quick. The skins for the characters are dope and I have definitely thrown some money into the game for those. Playing with the ability loadouts are interesting. Find the right loadout and you're golden. All in all, highly recommend! 

Just a side note but I started playing this game because of the Twitch Streamer Kruzadar!

Pros: The game is fun and interesting, the survivors and killers both have a diverse set of skills and perks. The use of licensed and original characters is cool, and the game is very generous with 'bloodpoints' making it easy to upgrade your character. 

Cons: The wait times for a match as a killer is just ridiculous, the tutorial doesn't cover all the gameplay mechanics such as powers, The perks system can feel very overwhelming and confusing at first, there's no single player vs computer mode, and the community can be really aggressive (Leaving even more want/need for a single player option)

Overall, if you want an online game where you can play as licensed horror icons such as Laurie Strode, Pyramid Head, or Freddy Kreuger, AND you don't mind having to figure out the game mechanics on your own, this might be the game for you. This game makes me wish Steam's rating system was different. Do I recommend this game? I dunno. It depends on what you're looking for. It's certainly less broken than other co-op games I've played. This game has more cons than pros but the cons aren't a deal-breaker to me so. I guess I'd give it a 6/10, and hope the devs listen to their fanbase's comments and make improvements.
